channel.title: Client crash?!
channel.description:
I'm coding a 713 server (Extreme KO, hopefully will be coded to another server, credits go to the owner of extreme KO :)) I coded the compiler, the server, the client's compiler and the client itself (as in I edited the BAT files to test the game before editing/coding it) so i downloaded a 713 cache from here: http://www.gigasize.com/get/11w8bg8kr4d and i extracted it and put it in server > data then i recompiled the client and server then i ran the server and clicked on the client...... and then this happens: [code]Cache Directory: C:\Users\Dell PC\ExtremeKO\ExtremeKO\cache Error: CacheLoader.method2752:191 CacheLoader.method2751:96 client.init:542 Load er.startClient:111 Loader.doFrame:50 Loader.main:33 Class52_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 java. net.URLClassLoader$1.run java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run java.security.AccessContr oller.doPrivileged java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass java.lang.ClassLoader.loadC lass sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass more Client\bin\Class52_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.class java.io.FileInputStream.open java.i o.FileInputStream.<init> sun.misc.URLClassPath$FileLoader$1.getInputStream sun.m isc.Resource.cachedInputStream sun.misc.Resource.getByteBuffer java.net.URLClass Loader.defineClass java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100 more | java.lang.NoClassDe fFoundError: Class52_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect at java.net.DualStackPlainSocketImpl.connect0(Native Method) at java.net.DualStackPlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Unknown Source) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.doConnect(Unknown Source) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(Unknown Source) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.NetworkClient.doConnect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.<init>(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(Unknown Sour ce) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at java.net.URL.openStream(Unknown Source) at IPAddress.method6062(IPAddress.java:171) at CacheLoader.method2751(CacheLoader.java:98) at client.init(client.java:542) at Loader.startClient(Loader.java:111) at Loader.doFrame(Loader.java:50) at Loader.main(Loader.java:33) ExtremeKO Client has crashed!crash[/code]
here's a picture also....
[IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/r01gzn.png[/img]
please help?! anyone? :( :mad:

item.title: Client crash?!
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

Sorry, then i don’t know.
maybe it’s something with your cache.
but as i said i don’t know

Read full topic

item.title: Client crash?!
item.dc:creator: @somepkhunterlol somepkhunterlol
item.description:
@somepkhunterlol wrote:

[quote=“xX4m4zingXx, post:2, topic:542163”]Are you connecting with 127.0.0.1 or with your own ip.
If you are connecting with your own ip make sure that you have portforwarded properly.[/quote]
I’m using 127.0.0.1 and the port is 43594

Read full topic

item.title: Client crash?!
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

Are you connecting with 127.0.0.1 or with your own ip.
If you are connecting with your own ip make sure that you have portforwarded properly.

Read full topic
